sentence.Network_en: Our feelings of happiness and sorrow are soon lost in the whirligig of time.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们感情上的悲欢会随着时间的流逝很快消失.

sentence.Network_en: The ancient doctor - patient relationship changes following the whirligig of time and society.
sentence.Network_cn: 古代医患关系因时代与社会的变迁而有所改变.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from whirl + obsolete gig 'whipping-top'

means.word_mean: 1. a conical child's plaything tapering to a steel point on which it can be made to spin;

sentences.sentence: "he got a bright red top and string for his birthday"

means.word_mean: 2. large mechanical apparatus with seats for children to ride on
1. whirl or spin like a whirligig
